titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to the Collection at the Indiana University Archives
titlestmt.author: Encoded by Beth Benda

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-04 05:11:57 -0500.

change.item: Batch update to change repository name, subject links, preferred citation, and user restrictions.

did.abstract: Albert L. Kohlmeier was an Indiana University alumnus and professor. Collection is comprised of the papers of Prof. Kohlmeier and family and consists of correspondence, publications, lectures, Lucie Kohlmeier's travel diary from a European trip taken in 1926, and genealogical information about the Kohlmeier family.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Albert Ludwig Kohlmeier was born on 24 March 1883, in Mackey, Indiana, the grandson of German immigrants. He graduated from Oakland City High School in 1900, and taught at a one-room schoolhouse in southern Indiana from 1901 to 1903. He attended Indiana University from 1903 to 1908, and received a BA degree in history. During this time he continued work as an educator at his old high school. He married Lucie Mayhall, one of his pupils, on 14 September 1910. After graduating from IU he attended Harvard, where he earned an MA in history, and returned to IU as instructor of history. He was made assistant professor in 1914, and associate professor in 1917. He earned a doctorate in history at Harvard in 1920. In 1921 he was appointed full professor at Indiana University, where he continued to teach even after his retirement in 1953. His specialties were colonial history, American diplomatic history, and American historiography. He was respected as a public lecturer on topics of American history. He retired as head of the History Department in 1948, and became professor emeritus in 1953, but he continued to lecture and serve on committees until his death on 28 December 1964. His wife Lucie remained active in university organizations, and she corresponded with family members and descendents in the US and Germany on the subject of family history, until her death in 1974.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Albert L. Kohlmeier papers and Kohlmeier family papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of the papers of IU professor Albert L. Kohlmeier and family organized into two series: Albert L. Kohlmeier papers and Kohlmeier family papers.

The first series, Albert L. Kohlmeier papers, consists of materials from his student days, his tenure as a professor at IU, and his period of retirement. Included are report cards, an inscribed Bible, teacher's certificate, and fraternity membership information; correspondence and records from his tenure at IU, including publications and lectures; and tributes and letters on the occasion of his retirement and later his death. Correspondence included in this series consists of letters from Kohlmeier's mother and father and from his professor at Harvard, Dr. Edward Channing. The series spans 1890 to 1965.

The second series, the Kohlmeier family papers, consists of material concerning Prof. Kohlmeier's wife, Lucie, and historical and genealogical material on the Kohlmeier family. Materials in the series include Lucie Kohlmeier's travel diary from a European trip she and her husband took as well as a memorial tribute to Mrs. Kohlmeier written by IU Chancellor Herman B. Wells in 1974. Additional items include materials about the history of the Kohlmeier family, such as Prof. Kohlmeier's grandfather's emigration papers from Minden, Germany, in 1860, letters from branches of the family still in Germany, and a genealogical report compiled by Aaron Wheaton and presented at a family reunion in 1982. The series spans 1860 to 1982.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Materials removed include grade books, 1913-1943; Prescott Townsend's monograph on Sextus Catius Clementinus Priscillianus; and photographs, which were transferred to Archives Photograph Collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See also Kohlmeier mss. at IU's Lilly Library

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have not transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Kohlmeier family collection, Collection C246, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.
